Package chessgame

Class ChessGame

java.lang.Object
chessgame.ChessGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
Subject
public class ChessGame extends Object implements Subject
The ChessGame class; Implements Subject class. This class is part of the MVC design pattern, and it acts as a model in the MVC relationship. The ChessGame represents a round of game consisting of two Player and a ChessBoard. It contains the game logic and relevant game data such as the current player turn, and the last moved piece. It is called by the ChessController.

Additionally, this class is part of the Observer design pattern, and it acts as an Subject. When being referenced to the ChessController, the ChessGame adds the former as an Observer and notifies Event to it for subsequence actions.

See Also:

  • Player
  • ChessBoard
  • ChessController
  • Observer
  • Event

    • switchTurnAndFlipBoard

      public void switchTurnAndFlipBoard()
      Switches the current player turn and reset their hasPlayed status. After that, flip the chess board.
      See Also:
      • Player.resetHasPlayed()
      • ChessBoard.flip()

    • switchPiecesIfPlayCountReached

      public void switchPiecesIfPlayCountReached()
      Checks if the total play count has reached the switch counter. If so, switch Time and Plus pieces and notify observers with Event.PIECESWTICH.
      See Also:
      • Piece.cloneToPlus()
      • Piece.cloneToTime()
      • observer.Event#PIECESWTICH

    • checkPiecePlayability

      public boolean checkPiecePlayability(int x, int y)
      Gets the Piece object at the specified x, y coordinate on the chess board and check if the piece is playable. Returns true if the piece is playable. If there is no piece at the specified x, y coordinate or the piece is not playable, returns false.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the Piece object located at the specified x, y coordinate is playable

    • checkPieceMove

      public boolean checkPieceMove(Point source, Point destination)
      Checks if the Piece object at the specified source Point can be moved to the specified destination Point. Returns true if the piece can be moved from the specified source to the specified destination. If there is no piece object at the specified source or the piece cannot be moved to the specified destination, returns false.
      Parameters:
      source - the source Point
      destination - the destination Point
      Returns:
      true if the Piece object at the specified source can be moved to the specified destination.
      See Also:
      • checkPiecePlayability(int, int)
      • chesspiece.Piece#isMovableTo(ChessBoard, Piece, int, int)

    • playPieceMove

      public void playPieceMove(Point source, Point destination)
      Plays a piece move by removing any Piece object located at the specified destination Point, then move the selected Piece object at the specified source to the specified destination. Returns if no piece is at the specified source or the piece cannot be moved to the specified destination. This methods calls checkPieceMove() to validate the mentioned scenario.

      After playing the piece move, notify the observers of Event.PIECEMOVE. If the selected piece is a Point piece and it reaches the end of the board, flip the piece.

      Parameters:
      source - the source Point (java.awt.Point)
      destination - the destination Point (java.awt.Point)
      See Also:
      • checkPieceMove(java.awt.Point, java.awt.Point)
      • Event.PIECEMOVE

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Checks if a player has won the game and notifies the observers of Event.PLAYERWIN if so. Else if no player has won, increment the current player's play count and set their hasPlayed to true.
      See Also:
      • checkWinner()
      • Event.PLAYERWIN

    • checkWinner

      public Player checkWinner()
      Determines whether each player has their Sun piece. If a player has no Sun piece, returns the other player as the winner. If there is no winner, return null.
      Returns:
      the winner Player object, null if there is no winner

    • switchTimeAndPlusPiece

      public void switchTimeAndPlusPiece()
      Switches the Time pieces to Plus piece and Plus pieces to Time piece.
      See Also:
      • Piece.cloneToPlus()
      • Piece.cloneToTime()

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if no exception occurs
